Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized present clinical features that include seizures, cognitive impairment, and motor impairment.

The study of Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized is hampered by the lack of relevant cell lines and animal models. The aim of this study is to develop a cell line and an animal model of Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized.. Some special cases also present with intellectual disability, autism, and sleep disorders.

Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized is a rare disease. The incidence of Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized is estimated to be less than 1 in 200,000.
